Yes, you're absolutely right! Michael Jackson was quite vocal about social and political issues, and he often used his platform to spread positive messages and advocate for change. "Heal the World" and "Man in the Mirror" are great examples of this. "Heal the World" encourages people to come together to make the world a better place, while "Man in the Mirror" urges individuals to examine their own behavior and take responsibility for making positive changes in their own lives and the world around them.

Jackson also addressed issues like poverty, racism, and environmentalism in his music. His song "Black or White" promoted racial harmony, while "Earth Song" was a powerful plea to protect the planet. By using his music to raise awareness and encourage action on these issues, Jackson became not just a pop star, but a cultural icon and humanitarian as well.
